sub_title: Doctoral Researcher at Delft University of Technology
summary: Dr. Max Holicki is a doctor of philosophy in geophysics, who has just received his degree from the Delft University of Technology for his work on the separation of (interfering) wavefields according to their travel direction and the implications this has for wavefield imaging. During his doctoral studies he was president of the local geophysics student chapter, which under his leadership reached the highest student chapter tier according to the Society of Exploration Geophysicists. He is an inquisitive, engaged and open-minded geophysicist with an inclination for novel unconventional solutions to problems. Based on his theoretical and engineering Ph.D. he is suited for theoretically quantifying problems and setting out to solve them practically in a result-driven and team-oriented fashion with a high degree of work ethic.

Deployment of the system would allow for easy visual noise identification during acquisition, based on which acquisition can be updated to match requirements.
